intro: Seyrigia gracilis, commonly known as the slender seyrigia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its slender stems and small, often inconspicuous flowers are adapted to its native environment. Seyrigia gracilis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential horticultural value.
